pQ5BlaOfqh0MrC39suHCXQ.text: We came here during the day and I loved the atmosphere :) I was bummed it was a little too hot to try sitting outside, because the patio looked really fun. I've had better burgers, but there's a great beer selection and the calamari is amazing!   They also have really great deals on all different days of the week, definitely something to check out if you know you're going to go!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yHEDF8K3ooyQONcf82Jb_g.text: Great food and atmosphere. Went here for a ladies Sunday brunch. Had the croissant breakfast sandwich with potatoes and it was tasty.

KE39jvGekH7Mdkh-16cfhw.text: I am revising my score up to 2 stars because The Vig management did send me a message which I was very impressed with. They took responsibility and apologized for each point that I had mentioned and shared specific steps they have taken to prevent something similar happening. He said they have moved the 'add chicken' button to a separate place from the 'side of chicken' button. They reviewed my pictures with their team of cooks and were looking at the dressing that they make for this salad.   He also offered to treat me for a second visit to give them a chance to redeem themselves. I didn't feel comfortable accepting the free meal, because that is not why I yelp, but I will however, go back sometime and give them a second chance and I will update my review again at that time. Everyone has bad days, but how you respond to failure says a lot. If I were giving stars for the response, it would be 5 stars and with that kind of leadership, I have no doubt that they will do well.

Kp-eeDt0EDiyPW_x6vKcmQ.text: Came here for dinner a few weeks ago after a concert a few blocks away.   I was impressed with the design and layout of the restaurant. The hostess working this evening was also very charming and was very welcoming when we walked up.  I can't remember her name, but she was really cute and had a personality to match her knee high sequined/glitter boots. There is a lovely outside bar area that is quite large.   We were initially seated outside at our request, but it got a little chilly for us so we asked if we could move inside.  The same cute little hostess was so accommodating and helped move our drinks and appetizers to an inside table.   Once we sat at that table, another table opened up inside the bar area, so we once again asked the cute hostess if we could move to the table in the bar as it was late and that seemed to be where most of the action was at this time of night.   The hostess kindly arranged for us to move to the table next to the bar.  That was really nice of her as I know it is such a hassle when customers do that, but she was very accommodating and helpful.   The food and drinks were wonderful.  The pazole was awesome as was the steak and Brussels sprouts. The bread pudding dessert was so very good. We also ordered blueberry martinis (I think that's what it was). They were fabulous! We must have ordered five or six of them they were so good.   We stayed until they made last call. They never made us feel rushed or acted like they wanted us to leave.  This is a great location nestled right in the city.   They have Great food, a cozy ambience, attentive staff and the cutest little hostess!

xSjCt8GT0ncowH3OUCs5LQ.text: This was my first time at the Vig. We went for my friend's  Birthday. I arrived 15 minutes early and sat at the bar. I had a bartender approach me once and I asked for one more minute to look at the drink menu. I put down the menu and made eye contact with three bartenders and they did not stop to take my order. There was only one other person at the bar. My friends came and I left the bar with no drink due to being ignored. They also removed my friend's party reservation, which she confirmed that morning. Our waitress served us the wrong drinks and decided to take a break. We waited 20 minutes and had to ask another employee to find her to fix our drink order. The service was horrible! I liked the outside patio and I'm giving it two stars for the food, which was very good.

DZ-iOQ9Ok2z11JDsQjVJYg.text: I got food poisoning here and the owners denied it, and then refused to answer my calls. I have read similar reviews of this happening to other guests at the restaurant as well. Please watch out and make sure to contact Poison Control if this happens to you at the Vig!

iCVzFxzjJaSScJq_VE7QRA.text: Yelp 100 Challenge 2018 - 10/100  Parking: Plenty of street parking on either side of the restaurant, and they're all free after 8pm!   Ambiance: This place has outdoor and indoor seating, with an outdoor bar and TVs for those who are interested in some outdoor seating on a warmer night. I definitely think this place is more romantic at night, with all the string lights around the restaurant.   Food: I saw the pictures on Yelp and I couldn't resist ordering the Mac & Cheese with Short Ribs added. It was not a mistake! The short ribs were very tender and juicy, it went perfectly with the mac & cheese. I asked for it baked, which made the mac on top a bit crispier. It was awesome! We also got the steak and fries, which I thought wasn't as good as the short ribs mac & cheese. One of the friends in the group couldn't eat beef but wanted the bleu cheese burger, and was able to substitute the beef patty for a crispy chicken with no extra charge!  I was also able to bring in a cake to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday without having some absurd cake cutting fee, which I really appreciated.    Loved the food and ambiance here at the Vig Fillmore, and would definitely be coming back for another celebration!

5fWjyZDlZ_SaKXbnGKjR8Q.text: Fire food  fire environment. Great service. Perfect for a Sunday funday in downtown Phoenix. Much recommend !

TPINB0tbp8oxF3s0X5SBAQ.text: This was by far one of the best evening service I have received in Downtown Phoenix. Not only is it a Friday night, but also 1st Friday. My boyfriend and I chose to self seat ourselves at the outdoor patio bar, which had ample seating. We started with a few beers and the chicken wings. The wings (traditional) were excellent! The food came out very quickly and piping hot with both the sauces we requested.  We then decided to split a Black and Bleu burger as our main course served with our choice of sweet potato fries. Not only did the bar back (Chris) that took our order describe the difference between regular fries and the sweet potato, but he also asked if we wanted ketchup in addition to the aioli that traditionally is served. Such a great way to anticipate the guest's needs!! The burger was served (already split for us- we didn't even ask) and it was cooked perfectly Medium as we specified when asked by Chris!  Our second round of beers was served promptly and with friendly service. Jenna, the bartender was excellent and followed up with us throughout the meal & experience.   What a phenomenal experience. Thank you Chris and Jenna- we'll be back looking for you both!!!!

ih11WF5pLFqz2XyYvULVZg.text: We have been here a few times in the morning or early afternoon and the service is always decent. The food and drinks are consistently good. Sometimes the service can be slow and forgetful but that doesn't bother us too much because we are enjoying ourselves.

3TijNr4RisCHxMEWs29Ozg.text: Always a great time. Food, drinks and atmosphere is awesome. Staff is great. Cannot say enough positive things about this place!   Bring back the Wedge salad!

dxsrObwB0bJQBmU04XNFzg.text: Short summary:  - TRASH service  - Over 50 minute wait time for food (table of 4) - Condescending manager named "Michelle"  The real Review:  For reference I frequented the North Scottsdale location numerous times but recently moved to the downtown Phoenix area. We were relieved to find a restaurant that we could rely on for the food and service. The Mac and Cheese is my favorite! This location has trash service, the management is less than adequate. We ordered a burger with Mac n Cheese (an up charge of 3 dollars for a side, which is fine but a very important detail) and my friends ordered Mac and Cheese. Our food took over 50 minutes to come out, it came out as soon as we voiced our concern. The food looked like it had been on the heating tray in the kitchen for over 10 minutes. The Mac and Cheese was dry(dehydrated) on the top and the burger itself was also dry. I didn't touch the Mac and Cheese. When the manager came over to talk to us she said "Well we got a new heating lamp in the kitchen". She offered to remake our side but we declined because at this point it had been so long and we wanted to eat. She gave us fries as a side instead and said "no worries I comped the Mac n cheese AND the fries". THE FRIES ARE A FREE SIDE WITH THE BURGER, like wow I am flabbergasted by how kind she was (totally being sarcastic). The entire time the manager had a condescending tone and was not being receptive to our table's concerns. Not once did we receive and apology or felt like there was an intent to make things right by both the waitress or the manager named "Michelle". I worked in the restaurant industry for 7 years and I can say this location is a big disappointment. Yes, I had time today to write a review because you don't treat customers like that.   CHERRY TO THE TOP: The waitress messed up on charging our cards.

wIOn7CZkQue6P0RHNDj7OA.text: This place has bad service and poor communication. I have worked for years as a waitress and was appalled by the service here.  I went last night on a Friday to this Vig location. I was very disappointed. When I arrived, I was told there would be a 15-20 minute wait and that I could sit in the patio area while waiting. I sat in the patio area for 20 minutes thinking I would be offered drinks or appetizers; various staff members saw me and my friends sitting but did nothing to tell us we needed to walk up to the bar to ask for drinks and appetizers. We finally walked up to the bar and ordered a few drinks and food. Not only did the bartender get our drink order wrong, he also informed me he had seen our group waiting and that we should have come up to the bar sooner.  After 30 minutes passed, I walked back up to the host stand and asked about our table. I was rudely told by the hostesses that I was next in line for a table and that I shouldn't have ordered real food at the bar because they try and discourage this. When we finally got a table, well after the quoted wait time, our server was clearly annoyed we had already ordered food and sent a new server over to deal with us.   On top of the bad service and poor communication, I ordered the Avocado Cobb salad and guess what was missing from the salad? The avocado. At that point, I didn't even have enough energy to complain.  All in all, it was a lousy experience that could have been improved by the staff simply caring enough to communicate with us what to do while waiting. I would not recommend going here.

ALewwhxMLlw3gUyRJmYhpg.text: Loved the atmosphere. Drinks by the fireplace on a weekday was lively yet intimate enough to hold a conversation. Inside was a bit loud and can take gig a while to order a drink. Loved the Thai and buffalo wings, don't skip out in the area salad either : )

S3zV6Yaj2zgsvbmNy8L9tA.text: The big is a great late night spot. They are open late for the foodies who wonder the streets hungry at night. I would always recommend their Mac n cheese with chicken and broccoli, super creamy and rich and the chicken and broccoli help to not make it super cheesy in texture. The service is always quick and friendly.

There was a hair in my friends burger which was a bit awful but the management was friendly enough and comp'd her burger.  She went to the restroom to clean her hands and there wasn't any soap.  She mentioned it to one of the staff and got shrugged off.  My food didn't have a hair and the men's had soap.  Winning!

yLA0P3v0i0o68vf7-J-N7w.text: We stumbled across this place on Super Bowl Sunday. We wanted to eat outdoors but they were to busy to accommodate us out there. We settle for indoor seating.   The food was great and our server was awesome. Cute establishment to have brunch at. Definitely coming back for more!

We started with appetizer of  with the calamari and it was delish!!Decided on a steak salad so I wouldn't be to full. The salad was porportion just right and was actually very filling.I made a great choice on my selection.I highly recommend this place to someone that is looking for a romantic or quick bite. Great service great food!!

y6Suseaoyd0bEF-j4BZFXQ.text: The food was great ! We ordered salads and soup. The service was terrible. The hostess was rude and unprofessional. There was no bartender while we waited for our table. I guess they were understaffed. They all seemed to be lost and unqualified to work there. I will stick to the Scottsdale location.

XVBeDY7TWfSyj80RFXSCew.text: I was expecting a little more from this place. I had been to another location a few years ago and remembered them having some excellent nachos and a cool vibe. In Phoenix for a conference, the Fillmore location was a couple blocks from my hotel, and I was stoked for those 'chos!  I sat myself at the bar as there was no host or server present up front. The bartender was nice and it was pretty quiet. A few patrons at the bar smelled very heavily like smoke, which was slightly unpleasant. I ordered a Hoegaarden and my nachos. I was kinda disappointed they weren't as good as I remembered, and they also had black olives, which the menu didn't state. I detest black olives, but I wasn't gonna complain. Some people do have food allergies, so it is important to list all the ingredients on the menu. I worked in a restaurant so I pay attention to things like that.  It looked like they had a decent happy hour and some good brunch items. I would return if given the opportunity and try something else.

7KyvJ0JTYYENWyZ7b1uPHg.text: I'm not going to give it a bad review at this time but I doubt I'll go back for a second try. I think my first mistake is that I came here for food and not to drink. It may be more of a libations establishment. Also, I came 1 hr before dinner service is over. We tried to make the ordering basic so as to not cause kitchen issues.  2 basic burgers, one order of macaroni and cheese and a charcuterie board consisting of about 40% grapes, a rolled up ball of prosciutto that we couldn't separate and a few slices of salami with 4 small pieces of crusted bread, one for each person. Total $80. No drinks! Actually, now that I write this I'm getting more and more pissed that I even gave it 3 stars. So, I'll stop here.

MPTvyKM4ThwC-DFaynJ8lg.text: The Vig was great. Food delicious and service great. Bread pudding dessert was memorable

V18jhNvEyTay8jxOTvwy0Q.text: Not the best prices but I guess the food is ok for happy hour , the drinks are small and water down to my taste , will go only for burguer night !

PTD_7WGNamZR2EPXqx9Qyw.text: Great brunch! Service quick and our waitress was very attentive. We chose to sit outside despite the hot weather, and the hostess was very accommodating in seating us near the misters and shaded area. There are a variety of mimosa options, and I enjoyed the pineapple one while my boyfriend enjoyed grapefruit. For a meal, I had the avocado toast and was pleasantly surprised by the large portion size and abundance of avocado. A+ for presentation as well

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xkr9ON0axLCtmaRvw2XYGA.text: I love this place. The drinks plus just about anything in the menu has been great! My friends can't get me out if this place.

Sr0gI1MuUrVfQo22lLtL5A.text: Came at 9pm on a random Tuesday.  The front entrance was closed which made it a maze to find the hostess stand.  The hostess informed us that they were finishing up and we could sit wherever.  I asked what time they stopped serving and she said midnight.  It seemed this was not for another 3 hours.....odd.  But she gave us the menus and told us to seat ourselves.  Thanks for that helpful interaction.  We ordered the ahi tuna salad.  The tuna was average and a little overdone.  The dressing was way too spicy.  It overpowered everything and made it difficult to taste the veggies.  Would have been nice if they add some cranberries or something sweet.  Also had the broccoli appetizer which was OK.  The brussels sprouts were Ok.  Neither was outstanding.    This one gets the big MEH.

I am obsessed with the passion fruit & pomegranate mimosas and the coconut French toast! I recently spent my birthday here too and they made it super special and provided an unforgettable experience. Looking forward to coming again this Sunday:)

WieHmQZEfN6KD-e1IDGqiQ.text: Service at this location slacks and they aren't really friendly. They were out of cocktail ingredients and beers on their menu. Food was different than other Vig locations. Probably won't come back to the Fillmore location.

0xoCqEPa3VDKtXNo6arLDQ.text: My first time here and a tad disappointed. I know it was a Friday night, but the service was slow. We were at a makeshift table overlooking a window that was tucked away from the normal traffic, so we ended up going to bar to get our drinks refills. Maybe that's the norm here, I'm not sure. When our food came out we did not have silverware, again maybe the casual atmosphere is set up so you need to request it (to multiple people). Our server was very nice, she appeared to be rushing so maybe they were short servers. As for the food, it was ok. My macaroni and cheese was dried out, as if it was forgotten in the oven. Since it was my first time, I will give it another try, but not on a Friday night.

fmBxk8qMyNy8pqeX6cdO_Q.text: This is the best happy hour spot in Arizona! You get so much food for little $. I love the out door seating area and live music. Make sure you try it out.

6Eg_-XWUdQwiAinpHHLjiw.text: The Vig Fillmore became my favorite downtown Phoenix restaurant while there for business the whole week. While it was a 5 min uber ride from the convention center and all the restaurants in that area it was so worth it!  It was so awesome, I went there for lunch and dinner, bringing my team to the wonderful outdoor respite of the restaurant. The patio is perfect for a relaxing afternoon, with water misters to keep you cool from the Phoenix heat. The appetizers are all great, including the guacamole and Thai-flavored wings. They offer a nice selection of entrees, including meat, seafood and healthy options. In addition, the cocktails are perfect for the time of day, be it a Moscow mule, mimosa or wine/beer.   This is going on my must visit list every time we go to Phoenix so definitely add this to your list!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh! And live guitar with music on Thurs night. Chad was awesome!

B7WChs-XBBv9jJkw-kwNYg.text: Love the Vig - especially Arcadia and McCormick Ranch. Honestly, it's a running joke in our office how horrible the service is at the Fillmore location. There's this weird smugness as if you're an outsider visiting a cool Austin or New Orleans spot that only locals know about, except it's downtown Phoenix. Get over yourselves, there's nothing cool about downtown Phx.

TUq8mejGtNalMAv2drufig.text: Six of us came to this Vig's location for happy hour, and it turned out to be a decent lounge for group gatherings. The premise was aesthetically pleasing. From the inside out, the three dining areas started from the indoor bar, an enclosed dining space, and then the spacious outdoor patio. People can come for happy hour from 3-6pm, Monday through Friday. TVs were available by the bars, as well as lives music performances later in the evening. The loungy atmosphere was relaxing, casual, and fun.   The Guac & Chips ($5) came with a basket of warm chips that came with refills, fresh guacamole, and pico de gallo. The consistency of the guacamole was thick, creamy, with solid textures. It could use some chopped jalapeno, but otherwise it was a good value item.  The eight-piece Hot Wings ($6) were grilled to perfection, with a firm meaty bite and sweet BBQ flavors that soon kicked in. The blue cheese dip was unnecessary, especially when the wings were not spicy at all. It was another good item to share.   The Fish Tacos ($6.5) came with double deck tortillas that were layered with blacken white fish, spicy slaw, pico de gallo, and tomatillo-avocado salsa. The fish was meaty, blackened with good flavor, but the spicy elements were again missing. The tomatillo-avocado salsa was a good addition, but the flavors could use a lift with a spicy citrus kick. Again, like other dishes, the food was good to share, but the flavors were kept too safe without any sort of risk-taking.   The Hummus ($8) turned out to be the most disappointing dish on the evening. It came with roasted garlic and siracha hummus that failed to distinguish from one to the other. The small, triangular pitas were served warm, but they were also stiff to the point it was crunchy. Epic fail, this was not a dish I would get again.  Overall, like many lounges, food was second nature when you have a wide array of drinks and great company. Service unfortunately was a hit or miss. However, the low-risk prices, along with the decor and ambiance culminated an enjoyable evening. Based on other reviews, I suggest for people to grab dinner elsewhere before coming here for a nightcap. Great for groups, I would return when I have out of town guests or special gatherings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VmsEljN-L3EprzlW3plUaA.text: So, my wife got almost deathly ill here. Since speaking with the Vig, we received no feedback. Her friend and her went here and shared the edamame and then each had water. They shared her side of fries. About 5 hours later, both were overtaken with horrible stomach pains and cramps that lasted about a week and they still have sore intestines because of it. They both called Poison Control and they advised us that the Vig either had contaminated edamame or water, or severely undercooked the edamame. this is DEADLY. we are in the process of speaking to the health department and we have not received any follow-up from the Vig. If my wife and her friend were older, they would have both been in the hospital. BE AWARE. Do not COME HERE.

YyZn3-RNVc7sWaGkKzwFjw.text: Went here for happy hour with coworkers. Always satisfied with the drinks and food. Service is a hit or miss. I love the ambiance, patio and most of all their nachos! One of the best nachos I've had in downtown Phoenix. Will be back soon.

ebpdBRdWOffLuzgexzLzSw.text: Another go to spot for me for happy hour which is posted next to Cibo. Cool backyard outdoor style area with a full bar. Really enjoy this place.

P-YtU54retqyqV55nWGPXA.text: Friday night I went to this restaurant to meet my friends who had just flew into town to celebrate a birthday. I had never been to this restaurant before and was told everything on the menu was good. There were several of us and we all shared our dishes. I was underwhelmed to say the least. I could've gotten over the mediocre food had it not been for the worst service and waitress I've had in probably over a decade. They took forever to bring out our food, at least twice forgot things we ordered altogether and one order was completely wrong. Then after being told on the phone that they didn't offer anything for birthdays we later found out they give a complementary slice of cake and an ice cream scoop. Later when the bill came they charged us for the dessert and we had to have the waitress correct the nearly $200 bill. People I tell you I could've gotten over all these blunders and mediocre food had it been for this waitress's horrible horrible attitude. It was clear she could've cared less about either us, her job or both. Whatever her problem was she should not have been serving tables that night. Highly disappointed this experience happened on my friend's birthday.

u2j1jOFPErGl4YMQ6EiLsw.text: The Vig Fillmore is always a solid place to go for lunch.  The food is delicious, the service is great and the atmosphere is perfect.  I have been to all the Vigs and this is my favorite.

a09d4jPCP-NNsP5XEXMJWw.text: Yesterday, I ordered the Mac & cheese with bacon and luckily decided to stir the bacon in before starting to eat. As I stirred I uncovered a small, dead cockroach in my pasta. DEAD COCKROACH   I'm horrified by this and sad. The restaurant was really cute, the outside patio looked great and our waiter was awesome. With the exception of wildly unfriendly hostess, I could have really liked this place. We obviously decided not to stay so the manager comped our bill and gave us a gift certificate that would work for any of their locations but I cannot get over a bug in my food. Still feel sick just thinking about it today.   Obviously will not return.

5w74lQ-HUFHTuBgvFSyPqg.text: I went there for lunch and ate outside at the bar. I ordered a Greek salad and a wheat beer. Everything was wonderful. Really enjoyed being able to eat outside in March since I was visiting from the cold midwest. Lots of free curbside parking if you're willing to walk 1-2 blocks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Greek salad with wheat beer.

_DC0wQGawzRRNU-pOKNY_g.text: I had dinner with The Girls Monday night, it was great! We played trivial pursuit questions- the cards are kept in old spice tins on the tables.  Our server, Kristina  was awesome!  She had a great smile and was very friendly!  Our food was hot and we didn't  have to wait for drink refills. We did not feel rushed and had plenty of time to talk, talk, talk, which was perfect!   We had chips, guac and salsa, yummy! We all indulged in burgers for Burger Monday! Yummy sweet potato fries and the dipping sauces, well they are made fresh every day and they are really delicious! We all shared one of the brownies and it was scrumptious!   Overall great experience,  the staff and ambiance  was great!  I will be going back!

71aFycuK10hB0e0Dvwf4dQ.text: Met up with a friend for dinner before going to a show on a Sunday night. We were pleasantly surprised by the lack of wait and immediately got a table inside. I have an autoimmune disorder with an accompanying list of food sensitivities that makes me really self conscious about eating out because I hate being "difficult". Our server was SO nice about my list and went and consulted with the chef about the ingredients of some of the salad dressings then suggested two that would pair well with the salad I wanted. I ended up with the Strawberry Fields salad with the red wine vinaigrette and it was so so good. My friend got the steak salad and charred broccoli and loved them both. Just an all around wonderful experience.

2h0tZ0Y6we6qvOUD8wRWgQ.text: We've been here many times and the food and service has always been great, but the Calamari is what keeps me coming back!!

Fpz06nFP56hGd3G4xQqS6Q.text: The Vig is pretty good. It is very convenient location-wise for me, so I've been here a dozen times. The burgers are pretty good and the brunches are certainly satisfying! I've also had good luck with the turkey sandwich and mac and cheese. Definitely somewhere to try.

6iCNTMwgGHBn1koUyIIWMg.text: My roommate and I went here for our weekly Friday night out dinner. We both loved this place!! We asked to sit outside because we saw how lively and nicely decorated it was. BEST DECISION! If the weather is nice and you're comfortable with sitting outside, do it!! The area is adorable, its decorated with such cute string lights going across the area as well as being in the trees. There's also an outdoor bar with TVs, which is awesome! As far as the food goes, I ordered the Poke Bowl with a side of watermelon. The watermelon wasn't something on the menu, but the server was more than happy to serve it. My roommate ordered the wings (half thai and half traditional) and she said they were great! I was already pretty stoked to be there just because of how cool the outside area was and the food honestly made it even better. If you're in the area or want to try something new, come check this place out!!!

rrOQPqTsVzAlugJcSvVV_w.text: I went to The Vig with some co-workers. The place was packed, yet we were served right away. The French Dip was yummy and the fries very crispy and tasty. Drinks looked good, but it was a school night so no alcohol for me. After we were finished eating we sat around chatting and they didn't seem to mind. Overall, a great plave. I'll definitely come back.

A8wd47hpH9VpJfQSNTMwdw.text: Super disappointed during my visit last night. Made a reservation, on the patio, 2 weeks ago for a dinner meeting... get to the host stand and the host just stares blankly at me and says there's no reservation. Oookkaaay? No apology, no sense of customer service. So we get stuck seated inside which has terrible acoustics, not great for a meeting.  Service was slow, food was ok.

97TfvEUVp4nuhtUUWv0P9A.text: Love this place great staff and food selection. The Pozole, wings, Nachos and meat and cheese boards are off the chain. Mix that with some Rum  and coke and your night is set. Sit inside or out and the vide is straight, nice little Phoenix gem that can handle customer traffic.

0Ggt68DVoJtDrEzLl8p3Nw.text: Was downtown for court today , and after a great morning with my three attorneys , I wanted to buy them a good lunch . I've been to all the vigs but this one is super cool , looks like a house from the outside , very good atmosphere inside . Got the lobster roll  special , it was spectacular .

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6_HOelvLlK9E9szoEi52Rg.text: Started with the big Vig bruschetta and then had the trifecta pretzel bun sliders fantastic! now out on the patio for some drinks and a birthday party great service,  great food, great atmosphere! Candice doing a great job! Then there is Ray on the patio, what a great guy!

7d-SVyO6its2mPEGAshsqw.text: The Vig (any location) has yet to fail me. LOVE LOVE LOVE that their kitchen is open late, even on Mondays when most of our favorite spots downtown are closed. Their late night menu consists of all of their best dishes: nachos, the trifecta (sliders, FAVE), posole, chips & guac, big bowl (fries or onion rings, or mix!), street tacos and more. The thing we cannot go there without ordering: the VINGS (Vig's hot wings). Please do yourself a favor and order these. The back entrance that goes straight to the patio of ample tables, bar, fire place, and corn hole is a very inviting and chill atmosphere. Don't forget to use the trivia cards and play with whoever you're with and ditch your phone! Staff is awesome and service is always great. Love the Vig.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana bread pudding. Delicious.
Photo of The Vig Fillmore - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artichoke, kale, &amp; jalepeno dip with pita and chips. I recommend!!

px2MLbUKBrXEqYG1iHM6Ew.text: I think I only have two check ins here. Whatever...   I have declared this location my favourite of all the vig locations. Some of the same staff as uptown, which I like. I can be sitting at the bar solo or with someone and the staff really treat you well. Making conversation on anything under the sun. Which is what one would like when sitting at the bar. If I'm at a table, leave me alone.   They have a really decent selection of craft beers on tap. I would love to have a way to know what's on rotation. In particular of all locations I love the outdoor bar here. This place used to be the local breeze and sitting out at the bar at the vig here brings back fond memories of hangover recovery Bloody Mary brunches.  The Vig Filmore is also going to be my pre Crescent Ballroom stop from here on out.   I'm a fan!

gKo8ZFAdd5MgnwE5wJfnZQ.text: So I already love The Vigs Arcadia and uptown locations, so I knew I was into the concept and the menu. Add in some cool cocktails - Melinda's Alley, do it - and amazing ambiance (dt phx, corn hole, huge patio, guys playing guitars), and The Vig Fillmore May be my new favorite Vig!  Side note: for those who remember, this is the old Palate location.

jeiWW45MzlSh2ONL5bKYng.text: Came here for dinner with my husband. The service was good and we did not have to wait very long for our food to arrive despite how busy they were. My husband loved his burger, he had the chorizo burger. I had the mac and cheese which was just ok. I only gave 3 stars because I feel their menu is lacking and could use a bit more variety. There is nothing else I would like to come back and try, although my husband would come back for the burger.

iEcLvGg5vguL9YVgDho3Sw.text: The food is amazing , everything has so much flavor. service is great inside , outside not so much but nothing too bad . I love this place & I recommend it to anyone!

iNEstrrKz0GwaH3zURo_Rg.text: The hubby and I came here for bunch on a Saturday afternoon. We sat on the patio and were pleasantly surprised how cozy it was. It felt like we were hanging out in our backyard. Misters, umbrellas, outdoor bar, and big shade trees. Our server was very helpful with menu recommendations. I ordered the Monte Cristo and hubs ordered the hangover helper. Both were delicious! Also $3 mimosas from 10am-2am, score! Dogs are allowed on the patio on Saturday's from 10am-4pm. We will definitively return.

uwcbDyYOdXQCNgDAAVlQaw.text: This wasn't my first time at the Vig, I have done the Vig for happy hour plenty of times which their happy hour is awesome food and drinks and great prices. This is my first time doing dinner and it was cool. I ordered a salad, the Greek it was yum. Friends ordered the Mac and cheese and another the black bean burger. Everyone was satisfied. The service was good. The price point is average. The vibe was nice. Its a great spot when the weather is great for indoor/outdoor. Great patio.

KTCu-e1OQQC30mEbgS067Q.text: I came here with a group of ten for their Novem-beer event.  I was nicely impressed with their customer service.  Our table on the patio was all set up when we arrived.  And they surrounded the area with heaters, so even though it was a cold and drizzly day, everyone felt pretty comfortable.  The Novem-beer event itself was fun, a good value for what you paid because you got to sample a lot of drinks.  Plus, they were supposed to punch your card every time you got a sample, but lots of times they didn't punch my card, so if I had wanted to, I could've gotten way more than ten samples (but I didn't.... I'm a light weight).  The service got slower when it got really packed, but we were fine with waiting since we were there to hang out and chat anyway.  Like the other Vig location, their food doesn't super impress me, but it's good enough to come back again.

fvtE_MD-MgQ8_XNeTcR9Pg.text: Awesome Vegan options. They will work with you and make it happen. Good food and stellar service every time. Solid.

ycupvdXu9uoJiwtlKiMG4g.text: The food was great! I got the Mac and cheese which was amazing. But our server (Kayla) was really rude from the moment we sat down. There was a party of 20 college girls more than half were not even old enough to drink let alone pick up the entire tab when we were finished.  The server assumed that one individual would pick up the tab  once we were finished dining. When we explained we would all be on separate tabs she gave serious attitude and told us it would take her a long time.  20 minutes later we finally got our tab....   I would come back again! But specifically request to not have this server EVER AGAIN.   PS. i wrote this entire Yelp as we waited a century.

QsHv8FjoCZTYmYTUXgZIRA.text: Very attractive restaurant and patio, well-trained staff and great food made for a nice evening. We enjoyed the Monday $5 burger and fries - delicious flavor and cooked perfectly.

2F45CLsDtrnjD6MSf_Ls8Q.text: Diverse crowd , strong drinks and amazing happy hour prices .. Tequila sunrise 3 rounds =$15 !!! Dope!   Nice space outside, great weather yesterday so took advantage of the patio. I heard Sundays are live with a DJ, I def want to go back then. My bartender was accommodating and always made sure I had a full drink! The place was clean and made me feel at home.. Will be back!   5 stars

rXLggjapJYSacF8VOyNeig.text: Great food/drinks and atmosphere, unfortunately we had a crappy server with an attitude like he didn't want to be there and was never around.

9Y0078wvgP9mHckkMNhAJQ.text: The Vig is my favorite downtown spot. The area is different that the other Vigs'  around the valley. Its in a neighborhood community, the home was turned into a restaurant. Parking however is difficult. The outside space with the yard is nice and huge with corn hole games.   You're greeted as soon as you arrive. I would recommend making a reservation for larger parties & ask to have the checks split before hand. It took an hour to get out bill figured out on my birthday night. I have also gone with a small groups.   The best item on the menu is "The Best Turkey Sandwich"! Its Thanksgiving in your mouth! The Mac'N'Chz with the add-ins and fish tacos were amazing as well. My son loves the kids menu! So good for kids. The cocktails are delicious & refreshing. I personally like sitting at the bar to see the drinks being made.  Best Sunday Funday spot with bottomless mimosas and a live DJ outside. It gets busy so get there early for a table.   A+ spot! Good food! Good staff! Great area! I'll be coming back often.

CIUKgAzrFAZzx8P7c-1ieQ.text: Literally sat in our booth for more than 15 min before anyone even came to our table. The waiters just walked passed us and waited on the tables next to us. The sign up front said grab a menu and seat yourself. There were no menus to grab. The bartender came from behind the bar to wait on the table next to us and did not offer us a menu or asked if we've been helped. Will it be coming back.

bIbVD9eaJ7mBpkzSUhyAig.text: Soooo this place is tagged as dog friendly...that's a big fat nope. Only on Saturday! Literally ONLY Saturday. No other day of the week. On a huge patio. Huh? So dumb. Got there with my extremely chill small dog tonight for happy hour with a friend and got denied. I love their wings but come on! Can't. Ciba was amazing btws.

F9Byg8ZxFnNTrZmVdzhZHg.text: I'm a fan of The Vig, and per a friend's request I met her here to check out the new digs.  I think because they are new, they are working out the kinks but there is lots of promise.  So it's hard to notice this spot because as of yet, there is no signage. It's in a house.  I drove the street twice til I realized the house WAS The Vig. The indoors is the restaurant portion and the side of the house is the patio area.  There are grassy areas, which is a nice touch and they have a central bar with seating all around, tables and chairs throughout the courtyard, and a fireplace with Adirondack chairs/tables as well.  The tall fence blocks out the traffic and construction going on nearby.  The menu is slightly different than 'my' Vig, but is primarily very similar. The bar waitstaff was initially a little slow, although it did pick up and they were all very cordial and helpful.    I'll come back next time I'm downtown as I think if y ou're a downtown dweller this could turn out to be as great as the other Vigs.

3tgZfrJuy6iULRuOrxJnTg.text: Inviting casual atmosphere with welcoming staff. Just had the Lean & Green Salad, would order it again.  If I lived nearby I am sure I would come here at night for drinks and HH.

wtyVORD8GQTYGQg0N3Qg3Q.text: This place was great.  Had a great patio, food was great and service was even better.  We had a group of 14 and they accommodated us very well.    Look forward to going back.

j0J72TbyX3rsYEr5wYnrAg.text: Living down in Fairview, the Downtown Vig has become our go to. Tired and just want wings? The Vig's outdoor bar. Dressed up with something to celebrate? The Vig's outdoor, candle-lit table. Taking out of town family to the Children's Museum and want a lunch we know everyone will love? The Vig's family-style outdoor tables. Every single time, we comment on the staff's professionalism and ability to make us feel at home and taken care of. Tonight, a small mishap with our dinner after 100 percent perfect meals every other time, and without missing a beat - the staff dealt with the issue with the same class they've exhibited at our celebration dinners, our lazy Tuesday dinners, and our "hey, how about The Vig" dinners. Here's to you Vig - and each and every one of you that makes your outdoor feel like our backyard.

FRjYKFGKd941oDLkClEWPg.text: Corn beef and hash WOW! LOVE THIS PLACE. From the hip hop funk music to the open atmosphere and the service. The menu is just the icing on the cake.

F-HrM412heFQ2WXZNrKiGA.text: Great neighborhood feel and great atmosphere. Indoor space is reminiscent of other Vig locations but has a great spin in the downtown Phoenix feel.

uPS1eudXrY577y-SDGD8tA.text: This place is amazing. From the minute w e walked in we were greeted and asked for how many. There was a wait seeing that it was Sunday brunch, which is very popular here, so we decided to eat at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and we ordered the horchata drink. Totally butchered that! It was delicious. Our food did take a little longer than normal so the manager took off an appetizer without us saying a word. Food is amazing, service is phenomenal, will always recommended and come back!

3kjQ-USuEQwxMY9xm4Nt6g.text: Poor service, the lady took a while to get to us along with all of her other tables. Also one of the employees asked a table if they could sample a reserve bottle of wine that they bought because he didn't even know they had that one & had never tried it before. Not only was he on the job trying wine at the table with the guest, he took the FIRST POUR. Wow. I don't know if he was the manager or owner but still that isn't right to me & especially in front of other customers as well. Totally unprofessional, are you able to go up to your tables & ask them for a sample of their wine whether it's reserve or not? Really odd to me. Also the appetizers were only a few dollars cheaper than our entrees, it was just a little overpriced.

n-fiTO0EKeWzr4mH5HN_Xw.text: This is one of the cooler spots in Phoenix that I've been to. My gf and I went a few days ago for happy hour, and I was thoroughly impressed. We ordered some unique cocktails, sweet chile wings, and some guacamole. Everything was spot on, and the prices were quite reasonable. Also, we had a server named Al taking care of us. He was one of the better servers I've had. We'll be back, and I think it's safe to say we found a new spot to be "regulars" at.

8BXyaev_FifNbA1syv0aWw.text: I love Vig, especially their nachos and half priced bottles of wine on Sundays. However, I sincerely dislike their indoor seating because this is where all the servers gather to chat, gab, and roll silverware. Management seriously needs to take control of the situation here because it makes me not want to go to Vig when I'd like to sit inside.

w5fTipC44co9IAT6XNuuVg.text: Can't say enough about how much I love this place!!! I've been there so many days in a row, I'm waiting for the staff to tell me to get a life. But I can't help it! The food is consistently amazing. The deconstructed fish tacos are out of this world-- fresh Mahi Mahi - and only $14. The pork nachos are simply heaven!  The hummus platter is awesome! And the wings are great!!!  And the happy hour food is some of the best selection and prices out there! Plus you can't beat $4 Titos through September!  To top it off, the service is OUTSTANDING!!!! Truly the best combination of great food and amazing service in an awesome location!

LOTk5r7VDO4U1839EEuTUg.text: Awesome place to hangout and have drinks during the day, after work...hell pretty much anytime of the say. The food is amazing and the bartenders definitely know what they're doing. I just discovered this place a few weeks ago and it has been my go to after a long day at work or a relaxing Saturday. The set up is really nice, to turn a house into a full functioning bar and restaurant is pretty awesome. Different from what I'm used to with Old Town bars and restaurants, a good different. This will be a spot I visit frequently!

UciMLLv6m50JAoMVBQpF9g.text: I gave this place a second chance because I live a block and a half away. The first time around, the food was pretty forgettable, especially the happy hour hummus which was runny and flavorless.  The second time, I went for brunch with my boyfriend and the wait time was 45 minutes (!) The vibe is young, wealthy white urban douchebags and wannabes. They have absolutely awful music blasting throughout the place-- so bad I would have preferred muzak or silence.  The music is so loud that patrons have to talk over it, so as a result, the whole place is loud which is strange for brunch. The overpriced eggs benedict were greasy and smothered in some bad (again flavorless) chipotle aioli.  The waiter had a very strange affect-- we flagged him down and asked him for the check to which his odd reply was to stop dead in his tracks, look at us and ask in a mocking loud smarmy voice, "would you like me to bring you the check?" as if we rudely interrupted him. Yep, that's what we asked. You're not on stage here, dude. Can you do your job without the weird bitchy theatrics?   The one star is for the drinks only.  I'm absolutely shocked that anybody would wait 1-2 hours to eat here. Also, the locale is off-- this place would be right at home in Scottsdale. Sad to see my neighborhood go The Way of the Douche, and it's just getting worse.

rPjEYc2WX4t8mrQtfpLTWA.text: So the food is "the vig food"... very good!  The problem with this location (hopefully) is that it just opened.  The service was not very good.  What this place needs is a couple months to work out the kinks... then it will probably be as good as the others.  Now I see why the ratings are lower at this place.

l4u4uhbpZNImnKDjb-gkAw.text: Very poor service. One person in our party didn't get their appetizer, another two ordered coffee with creamer and the coffee was brought but the creamer was completely forgotten about. Waiter didn't place all the orders for our table. When called on it, had the order brought by a waitress so he didn't have to bring it to the table (it was in plain sight that he handed off the dish to the waitress). Food that was brought was incorrect. Al was the name of the waiter. Make sure you ask for someone who has a little more experience waiting on tables.

ZzHXp-eA35cGh-DkYMAuew.text: New to Phoenix and great place adjacent to downtown.  Located in older home with great ambiance indoors and outdoors.  Outdoor bar to appreciate an happy hour in the glorious evening winter weather of Phoenix,.  Attentive staff and good food with a calmness.  Free street parking,  food good.    Waiter forgot to mention meat on a recommended dish when ordering served a teaspoon not properly clean.but freely replaced once recognized error and gave some credit on bill for inconvenience.  They  are interested in customers!

1199ny6ZH7PiPD252LqHfg.text: Friendly staff, great food, and great service. Defiantly worth a try! Their food prices average about $10 a plate but great tasting. You can't beat their daily bottomless mimosas (until 2pm)

YrWTwd_hnOZwnC8MDAA01g.text: We sat outside and it was gorgeous. Had the sliders and oh my goodness! Amazing. The fries were so tasty and the brownie! YUM. The only meh thing I have was that the actual server was a little slower. She was so nice and helpful though.

d2nDgNUYyHepaiL8ldfIAQ.text: This is the second time I've been to this location and both experiences were horrible! The first time my waiter was a complete hipster douchebag who made me feel like an idiot because I didn't know what bottomless mimosas were, innocently I've never heard that term so I did what any inquisitive person would do and asked. Was he nice about it? No! He teased me the whole time and posted it on Facebook where his loser hipster buddies can laugh at me. Second was when I was summoned to a business meeting with a new client. The dinner was nice and the service was better this time, however, at the end of my meal as I'm ready to pay I notice a chewed up piece of bubblegum on top of my plate. I asked everyone at the table and seriously doubt a new client of mine would dare place their chewed up gum on my plate. The manager spoke to us and very apologetic and as I was leaving he handed me a gift card for $10. I guess I'm not hipster and loser enough to dine at The Vig in downtown.

xsarjLaGQ694dtv8XB1fHA.text: Bloody Mary bar was good, food was delicious and atmosphere was good. Football was on as well. I'd recommend this place to friends :)

hvBYrmtU_cpXOXlwL45LuQ.text: Loved this place!  The food was great, service was great, and the atmosphere was awesome!  Came here with a group of 8, at prime dinner time, and was quoted a half hour to 45 minute wait.  Not a big deal for us since we weren't in any hurry.  However, we were pleasantly surprised when seated only after 20 minutes.  Our server was attentive and very nice.  He even split up our checks and let all of us use our Localdines coupons we had!!  Thank you!!  I got the black bean burger and it was amazing!!  Tons of flavor and our server suggested I get the mixed fries of sweet potato and original and that was a great suggestion!!!  A little bit of everything!  We sat inside at a part that looked like a sun room.  It was extremely clean and classy and felt really comfortable with our big group.  The outside looked really nice too but we didn't have a chance to experience that.  Valet parking is complementary in the back between The Vig and CIBO.  Which is a total PLUS!  Parking is so hard to find downtown.  We will definitely come here again!!

qiOIpuRKrtOBJJ-Eo0QKlA.text: The Vig is the perfect spot to relax with a glass of wine and late night snack after a show downtown.  My husband and I tried it for the first time last night and were seated on the patio.  Love the ambience.  Late nights they have a limited menu, but a good selection.  The nachos were great - worth a try.  The wine selection was broad and both reds we tried, were luscious.  Our server, Chad, was personable and attentive.  We will definitely be back.
